abstract: The new group is part of a trend as banks focus on helping start-ups raise capital without having to list shares publicly.
snippet: The new group is part of a trend as banks focus on helping start-ups raise capital without having to list shares publicly.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America Merrill Lynch has set up a group to help companies raise money through private fund-raising, the investment bank announced in an internal memorandum on Thursday.

headline.main: Bank of America Merrill Lynch Opens Private Fund-Raising Arm for Start-Ups

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
